ar Peer aa
ORDER

Petitioners are the accused in C.C.No.1230/2015
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Kannur,
registered for the offence punishable under Section 498A
read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

2. Petitioners have come up with this Crl.M.C. under
Section 482 CrPC. for getting Annexure-| complaint in
C.C.No.1230/2015 before the Judicial First Class
Magistrate's Court-l, Kannur and all further proceedings
based on it, quashed.

3. The allegation against the petitioners is that they
have tortured and harassed the defacto complainant, who is
the wife of the 1* accused, and treated her with cruelty
within the meaning of Section 498A IPC, by demanding
more dowry, after misappropriating her entire gold

Basal
2016/KER/33661
CRL.M.C.No. 4239 of 2016 uoe
ornaments and money,

4. Heard learned counsel for the petitioners, the
learned counsel for the defacto complainant, who is the 2"
respondent herein, and the learned Public Prosecutor.

5. According to the petitioners, all the matters in
dispute between the petitioners and the defacto complainant
have been amicably settled and presently the defacto
complainant has no complaint against the petitioners and,
therefore, the proceedings against the petitioners may be
quashed.

6. The defacto complainant, who is the 2"
respondent herein, has filed an affidavit affirming that all the
matiers in dispute between her and the petitioners have
been amicably settled and, therefore, she has no complaint
against the petitioners, and, hence, all further proceedings
in the matter referred to above can be quashed. She has
entered appearance through her counsel. The learned
counsel for the defacto complainant also endorses the fact

LEER
2016/KER/33661
CRL.M.C.No. 4239 of 2016 uae
that the affidavit has been sworn in by the defacto
complainant on her own volition. Therefore, it is only just
and expedient in the interest of justice to quash the
proceedings referred to above.

In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-l
complaint in C.C.No.1230/2015 before the Judicial First
Class Magistrate's Court-l, Kannur, and all further
proceedings in C.C.No.1230/2015, as against the petitioners
herein, are hereby quashed.

Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE.
